message: I propose we split the $10,000 in a 60/40 ratio, with you receiving $4,000 and me receiving $6,000. This way, we both get a fair share while considering the diminishing value of money in subsequent rounds.
I propose a 70/30 split, with me taking the larger share to account for the increasing value of money in subsequent rounds, despite the initial 10% decrease in value for me.

Considering the inflation and the value loss of money in each subsequent round, I propose an equal division of the $10,000, with both of us receiving $5,000. This ensures fairness and takes into account the decreasing purchasing power of the money.
